My wife's stomach began to churn as soon as we were seated and now wanting to be wasteful, she opted not to order an entrée but rather grab a smoothie from the Jamba Juice across the parking lot. My wife left the restaurant, and after I placed my ordered and informed our waiter of the situation, the owner quickly sprung upon me and in the rudest tone imaginable, she barked that if my wife was not purchasing an entrée of her own, that she would not be allowed to join me at the table. She then suggested that my wife wait in the hot car until I finished my meal. I reassured her that I was a paying customer and that neither of us had done anything wrong to warrant such hostility. The owner then made her way to the front of the restaurant and WAITED outside for my wife to return, scanning the parking like a hawk. Because I had texted my wife to inform her of the situation, my wife kept her head down and quietly rejoined me at our table; the whole time the owner never took her eye off us. To show her discontent, the she hovered over our table like a shark circling its prey, waiting for her opportunity for another confrontation. Uncomfortable and knowing that we had over stayed our welcome, I opted to pay the bill and leave quickly, rather than be a victim of her ridiculous antics. It was a no brainier considering my food tasted like it came from a can of Chef Boyardee. It was awful; in fact I would've preferred Chef Boyardee. In the end, I paid $75 for canned food and the worst dinner experience of my life. The only positive thing I have to say is that our waiter was friendly; too bad he has to work for such a terrible woman. How does this place stay in business? STAY FAR AWAY!

My wife and I had a wonderful dining experience last night at Gaetano's Restorante.  The owner came over and greeted us.  The staff were very nice and attentive to our every need.  And our entree's were wonderful.  I had the Cioppino and my wife had the Risotto. Both were real taste treats and enough to take home for another meal.

While family was in town I took them here on a Sunday night. Not very crowded at all which I was happy about. This was definitely a fine dining/romantic type of place. The wait staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Our server Zach was very friendly and definitely knew what he was talking about. I like that they bring out foccassia bread as well as regular Italian bread.  The quality of the food is very very good, you can tell its homemade and not frozen/canned/premade, the portions are just super small which generally is the case with fine dining. I would return, but probably just on a date on with family. If I was going out with a friend I'd go to Brio for happy hour. Definitely worth trying, but don't expect Buca portions.

Highly recommend this place. Food very good. Our waiter Steve gave us the free appetizer even though we had a Groupon....that was very classy....love the attention to detail...nice place for a romantic date.....thanks again gaetanos you have a beautiful restaurant and wondering staff....Nick is awesome!!!!
The best Italian food.  Superb.   Good drinks.  Super service.   Nice atmosphere.  Our favorite restaurant in Henderson.  And our out of town guests vote is best of Las Vegas as so we

Always great! Went with friends and he requested beet ravioli which is never on the menu but they made it for us (we ordered it as an appetizer) and who would've known I would like beet ravioli? Buttery sage complimented the sweetness of the beets so deliciously. Rory and Gaetano always make us feel like family when we enter their friendly establishment! My saffron risotto with prawns was perfect! The prawns were grilled and so, so tasty which complimented the creamy, delicately flavored saffron risotto. I'll definitely be back again and again!

This spot is a must stop for anyone looking for delectable dishes in the Vegas area that are off the strip. They have previously won the best of Vegas award and continue to achieve that same standard.

We had an urge for italian and wanted to try a new place. Since my bookmarks just seem to keep growing, I decided to check there first. Not suprising, this place showed up.  From outside it looked like a typical strip mall restaurant but after walking through their doors, this place transitioned itself to a bold and elegantly decorated space. The dining tables were spread on a huge open layout, nice tall vaulted celing and dim lighting that set a nice tone.    What we got:  House Bread and dip: I loved the their plain slices of bread dipped in their olive oil red vinegar. But even better was their stick slices of what I call deep dish pizza with no cheese and just a little tomato sauce. We were off to a nice start!  Bruschetta: small thin toasted slices of bread with garlic, fresh chopped tomato and parmesan + herbs. Very nice but could of done without this, since their House/comp bread was great!  Ravioli di Pollo alla Genovese (homemade chicken ravioli with pesto sauce): chicken was pureed and stuffed in the delicate pasta surrounded by the typical pastel green color pesto sauce. It was Really Good! Only negative was that we felt that a little more chicken in each ravioli would of balance the pasta/filling ratio much better.  Ossobuco alla Milanese (braised veal shank, redwine, fresh herbs, tomato sauce served on a bed of saffron risotto): The Meat was Absolutely Delicious! Only negative is that it wasn't as tender as it could of been, maybe another hour or 2 of slow cookin' should done the trick?! Good size meat portion;although, I've had bigger. Bone marrow was tasty little treat but it was on the small side and filling seemed missing?! The risotto was perfectly cooked, paired with the shank and sauce, was incredible!!   * I also had a Sterling Cabernet with the Ossobuco and it was splendid :)  Tiramisu (homemade in house): Nicely presented and tasted fantastic. They use an Amaretto type liquor which definitly comes through and was quite unique from what I'm used to. And the texture was on a sharp point! Very nice choice to end a memorable dinner.  Beautiful Decor, Mellow Atmposhere, Great Food, Service Impressive and Value was Great for quality! Yeah, I like this place!
Lovely elegant place with neighborhood atmosphere! The owner personally comes to your table & asks if everything was ok.. That's rare to me... Love it!

A real gem for the neighborhood. They have a super friendly wait staff and delicious food. You'll find all your Italian favorites, plus and abundance amount of daily specials.   The restaurant starts you off with fresh bruschetta for the table and a bread basket filled with house made tomato focaccia, accompanied by a small dish of oil and balsamic for dipping. Not a bad way to start while you look over the menu.  Squid Ink Risotto (a special): toothsome, fragrant, and rich in flavor. The squid were tender and moist, but the dish could have used a hint of lemon or some sorrel. The risotto itself was cooked very nicely.  Veal Parmigiana (with a request of vodka sauce instead of marinara): kudos to making excellent pasta. It was perfectly al dente and the vodka sauce was delicious. The veal was moist and tender, had a thin coat of breading, which is what I like, and topped with fresh mozzarella. It's a pretty solid dish, although I would have liked my veal sliced a little thicker.  My father in law had their pan seared trout, which came super fresh. It sat next to a bed of spaghetti and marinara, again perfectly cooked.   I wish we had room for dessert, which means we will have to come back again.

We were in the mood for Italian food and decided to try this restaurant out. Were very surprised by the ambiance of the restaurant and how great the service was.  Food was excellent and flavorful.  We will definitely be back!

Went with a group of 5 and it was one of the most memorable meals ever.  The food was fantastic, but it was exceeded by the warmth and attentiveness of the owner and staff.   The ravioli sampler appetizer was great.  The veal scallopini was terrific.  But those who ordered the pappardelle with sirloin tips special hit the jackpot.  Their take on cioppino included half a lobster!  Everyone was happy with the food.  Very nice decor, not immediately apparent from the strip mall exterior.  Nice wine list.  Expensive.   But a truly exceptional meal.

This restaurant was a wonderful surprise. It's located in a strip mall and doesn't appear to be much of anything from the exterior. But once inside, it's actually modern, sophisticated, elegant, and even a bit fancy. But don't worry, most everyone patronizing was still dressed casual.  The wait staff were very professional, attentive, and courteous. The menu and wine list are both fairly extensive. And the list of daily specials was pretty extensive too. So many decisions!  I opted to listen to my fellow Yelpers and get the gnocchi gorgonzola. I don't usually go for gnocchi, but I definitely love gorgonzola. It was divine! Fabulously perfect gnocchi. And very rich and creamy sauce. And so incredibly filling. I took over half of it home. And it was still delicious reheated.  All in all, my friend and I had a very enjoyable dining experience with some very delicious pasta dishes. And it's only like 5 minutes from my house. So I will most definitely be returning.

Delicious. Love This Place. I go there when I want to spend a little bit more and want something other man my $1 pasta at home. I would give it 4 stars for the portion size; because they could add a little bit more to some portions (Pasta in particular) I always eat it up and ask for a little more bread to fill completely up before I get dessert for my second stomach ^_^ Great Place!

Being an Italian from New York, I am extremely picky when it comes to this type of food. I went here with some family once, and the owner actually walked around to check on every table. Our family ended up talking to him, in italian, because he was born in the same town as a few family members of mine.   They are extremely nice, food is outstanding and from what I remember, he gets his fish for the restaurant fresh to make sure that the flavor is the best it can possibly be. Its tough to find good fish in the desert, but this place will not let you down!

Went on Xmas Eve with friends at the last minute. Called for a reservation and said ok I will take the reservation at 8, the hostess says to me "you gonna show up'? ??? Uh Yeah....Get there and of course I had to make a snarky comment that in fact we did show up. While the food was good didnt think it was the best Italian as others have said. When the waiter asked if I wanted parmesan cheese he didnt ask my friend so I asked if he would like some. The waiter then preceded to tell me that they dont put parm on that dish (clams and pasta) but he would and hope Gaetano wasnt looking. As a foodie I know that big name chefs dont put parm on fish but I didnt think we were at Spago or Mario Batalis. This is not an upscale place but I think it wants to be. It tries hard to be something its not.

This place is a diamond in the rough of Vegas restaurants.  I had a groupon that brought me into Gaetano's and it reminded me of being in an Italian restaurant in Boston or New York city.  The wine list was fantastic and they had an extensive traditional Italian menu with lots of seafood, veal, and pastas.    We ordered the special Bresola and the Veal Ossobucco, as well as a cold appetizer platter with various italian meats and pickled vegetables.  The food was good and definitely classic Italian.    The owner came over 3 or 4 times to ask how everything was to ensure we had a great service experience.  I will definitely be returning to Gaetano's.

My wife and I found this place somewhat randomly while visiting Las Vegas. We stayed at the M. Resort to be off the strip (she's there a ton for work) and just cruised around Henderson on Yelp looking for Italian food. Gaetano's did not disappoint. It's not your spaghetti-and-meatballs-red-sauce place (though I'm guessing you can get it).  My pasta was perfectly cooked, the dish was interesting: gnocchetti (tiny little shells) with little sausages and broccoli rabe in a light garlic sauce. It was light and rich at the same time. The portion size was perfect. I didn't feel like I ate a manatee. The bread wasn't great, but it's a small issue. We had their house cabernet and it was excellent...just a hint of fruitiness and really smooth (I called it buttery, but "smooth" is probably a better word).  Friendly, helpful service, nice ambiance, nothing inventive. Listen, I'd love a brick building tucked away in some quiet downtown neighborhood with two dogs eating spaghetti out back, but I'm impressed that they've created a such a great restaurant right there in a strip mall.

A little pricey for the serving size, that said.. The most amazing gnocchi I have ever had!!!! And I choose gnocchi every time I can and this is by far the best I have ever had. Be ready to spend $30 Per person or more but def. try it!

This was a little excursion I took with my best friend. Of course we had to sample all manner of appetizers and wines, because that's what best friends do when we're together. Plus we had almost the entire dining room to ourselves, so the service was impeccable.   The calamari was fantastic and came with a side of marinara. Amy would only eat the rings, but I ate the full small calamari and thought it was great. She said the little ones with all the tentacles freak her out. It was lightly breaded with what seemed like partially cornmeal and crispy fresh. I debated that the small ones were more tender. We then divided the plate so she had all the rings and I have the tiny tentacles, and we were good.   The fried zucchini blossoms stuffed with goat cheese was my favorite. Amy doesn't like goat cheese, so I ate them all quickly and efficiently while she munched on mussels. We both enjoyed the artichoke hearts, and the lemon sauce was light and complimented the dish nicely.  Next came the special, a buffalo mozzarella with fresh arugula and tomato. This was also very good with a sweet balsamic, but there wasn't much of it, so it went fast amidst our conversation about "what if they made cheese from milking buffaloes". Our server wasn't terribly impressed, but she was sweet and gracious. And more wine ensued...   Amy is a fan of Merlot, and picked up a bottle. I like Riesling. I like a sweet German Riesling to be exact. They had my second favorite on tap, Chateau St. Michelle. It's crisp and sweet and was pleasant with our selections. It was a fun night with great food and fun conversation. I will absolutely be back.

If they treat Groupon users like this why do they use it. We went with 5 people,two had purchased Groupon coupons.luckily we mentioned we would like 2 separate checks as we will be using groupons.The waiter informed us the policy was one per table.We asked to see management to hopefully explain we were unaware of restrictions. To our dismay an ARROGANT Woman without introducing herself MARCHED over to deal with the HOMELESS PEOPLE.Without giving us a chance to explain She informed us the limits were clear.Her contempt for our thinking that We could split up to use .another table for 3. She informed us we came in as one group. Loudly suggesting we may want to leave now.WE DID NEVER TO RETURN. We will rethink Groupon if this is the treatment. Instead of trying new places at a discount we will avoid being treated as destitute people looking for a free meal. Her disdain and contempt for coupon users was palpable.DO NOT patronize this establishment unless you enjoy being berated by condescending people
place is awesome.. just tell them what you like and let them figure it out.. it works well.  If you're really picky.. just go to a strip casino buffet instead.

Bought a groupon for $20 for $40 and thought this place was still good. No wonder they had a groupon as this place was not like it was before. Place was empty on a Friday night! After reading the reviews of this place further (after our meal) expect to be seated towards the back by the bathrooms if you have a kid. The food was ok, i had the arugula salad and lasagna. I now wonder why my lasagna  was so tiny.  I felt like I was eating a creme brûlée because they put it literally in one of those baking dishes for a creme brûlée. I want to say only 2 layers and watery.  That's probably because I told them I had a groupon before we ordered. Darn! Keep it quiet until you pay!!! Service was good for the most part, probably because there were like 5 tables there! I could tell our server had a cold. His nose was dripping while he explained the specials! Germs! Yuck!!!  The best part of it at the end, the owner lady came rushing towards our table like a mad woman and basically tossed our check on the table. Like she was pissed that we had a groupon. Wow! Not the first I see as I read prior reviews of this. Trust me, go to carrabbas instead, more for your money!

Horrible service.  Went in to this restaurant with my pregnant wife and I.  As I told them table for two I saw plenty of open tables, the owner/manager then told me "you two can sit at the bar not in the restaurant".  I then asked him why is that and his response was "if you don't like it you can leave" .  Never been so disrespected in my life.  But thankfully I went to Delmonicos at the strip were my money was appreciated

Very disappointing.  Our waiter, a very nice guy, failed to tell us all of the specials for the night.   After ordering, we overhead the waiter at the next table advising of the specials which included 3 dishes that we were not advised of.   Both my wife and I would have ordered one of the specials not mentioned if we had heard about them.  When our food was delivered, my wife's order was incorrect.   Once it was brought out correctly, the owner says to her you didn't ask for gluten free pasta.   Her response was Yes, I did, it was clearly stated to the waiter.  The waiter even went into to confirm with the chef and then repeated the order back to her correctly.   I then told the owner about not hearing about 3 of the specials and he storms back into the kitchen to yell at someone.   However, he never came back to apologize to us, offer to fix our meal or offer an alternative meal.  Obviously, there is a management problem with this place.   The food was just OK, nothing special.   We will not be going back, nor will we recommend this place to any of our friends.   Its unfortunate when a place has an opportunity to impress you with the service recovery and a few simple words but they don't know how.
Great food and customer service. Nick is always friendly and remembers returning customers.

We have been to Gaetano's several times.  It's amazing, but pricey.  Look for a Groupon or Restaurant.com coupon to help defray the cost.  Zach was our favorite server too (like Sarah said), but he quit to go back to school.  Server this last time (who didn't give his name) was very knowledgeable, but not much personality.  The food is amazing though!  We had the baked artichoke appetizer.  My wife had the Fettuccine Alfredo, which was with homemade noodle and it was good.  The real winner was my homemade sausage ravioli, which was sublime.  Only the somewhat snooty service and high prices keep this place from 5 stars.
Excellent Place for Itialian food!  Bravo!

Love their basket of bread! The texture, the taste; simply perfect! All the servers were very pleasant and the interior decor is warm and cozy. My chicken  ravioli with pesto sauce was tender yet some chewiness-just how I like it!

We've always arrived without a reservation, but we have arrived shortly after their opening time of 5PM, and we've been seated immediately.   This is a gem of a place, located in a strip mall. You can dress up or down. We've been there when they've hosted wedding receptions, and it's just a lovely, warm inviting atmosphere.   We stumbled upon this place one evening, and we went back for our weekly date night for the next three weeks. The food is fabulous, the staff friendly, and the service???? Frankly, whoever is the manager of this place, note to you: Please, please, please start a "Master Class" at some local college to instruct other restaurants on how to properly take care of customers. You'd be so rich, it'd be crazy. Other nicer restaurants WANT to be what this place is.   They have staff who just serve water. Staff who just bring out meals, staff to send out bread, staff to refill drinks, of course a sommelier, a manager who goes to each table to inquire about the meal, and to offer suggestions and support. And the main wait staff??? They are crazy informed about each daily special, and they know that menu by heart. So, if you feel like something light? They can offer suggestions. Want something hearty? They have that too.   I love their ravioli with tomato sauce, very light. I love their homemade pasta with shaved tenderloin in a mushroom sauce. Divine. The half chicken is so moist and delicious, my 13 year old devoured the dish with abandon. Even the attention to detail regarding mashed potatoes is visually appealing. Go once, relax with a nice wine, and enjoy. You'll love it.  Or don't go, that's fine. That way, we can still get in without a reservation. :-)

The owners lack human decency and respect for those who use coupons (groupons) and those who sit with a party and don't order from their menu.   I will never patronize this establishment again. I encourage everyone to look at the 1-star reviews, as there seems to be a pattern with the owners of Gaetano's. They are entitled and selfish.
I love the spumoni ice cream.  tiramisu is good too.  ordered also the  tortellini soup---it's ok  goat cheese salad ---decent  the daily special salmon stuffed crab is really good.

We were given a Groupon for $40 to this restaurant (which was going to expire this November) so we thought we'd give it a second chance.  We have been here before (maybe about a year ago) and weren't too impressed so we never came back.  Any how, below was our order:  -Appetizer: Brodetto $14.95 Clams and mussels, sautéed with garlic and served in a white wine and spicy tomato broth with garlic toast  I have to admit although it was pretty skimpy on the clams and the mussels, the broth was delicious.  It had a tad spicyness to it and was creamy with a hint of basil.  Almost reminded me of a hearty tomato soup.  -Entree #1: Rolatine di Melanzane alla Siciliana $16.95 Grilled eggplant stuffed with angel hair pasta in a fresh tomato sauce, topped with mozzarella cheese and bake  This was also good.  You get 3 pasta stuffed eggplants covered in fresh tomato sauce.  Again, the tomato sauce was yummy.  Had a tad sweetness to it kinda like spaghetti-o's...lol!  The eggplant was lightly battered (maybe pan fried, rolled then baked).  -Entree #2: Gnocchetti Sardi $19.95 Gnocchetti Pasta with olive oil, garlic, sausage and broccoli rabbi  We were disappointed with this dish.  The broccoli rabbi was over cooked resulting in a very bitter taste.  This broccoli is suppose to be slightly bitter; however having it overcooked resulted in an increase in the bitterness.  The pasta was slightly overcooked as it seemed quite chewy and The sausage was average. Nothing special.

I would really give this place 5 stars but there was some confusion with their restaurant.com and Nick's Sunday/Monday wine specials. The coupon is $25 off $50 in food purchase. Great, easily done, my dish alone cost $50. We spent over $100 in food. We got a bottle which normally was $40 and was on sale for $22. Now, none of this would have been an issue if someone had told us that we couldn't get it for that sale price with the coupon, period. No putting it off on it's own check, no nothing, even with over $100 worth of food.  So when I got the check with a $40 dollar bottle of wine that retails for $10 at Total Wine. I was not overly happy. Sever said there was nothing to do. I just wish someone had warned me about this prior since I would have stuck with cocktails (which sounded like drinks to write home about) and not the wine.  Here is the good now: Nick has the bombastic mustache. Our server Jacob was fantastic as well, some of the best and most prompt service I have gotten in Vegas in a long while. All that was missing was a crumber. Haha. The food was divine, we got the bordetto mussel app, the broth was flavorful and even good to dip bread in. I got the veal osso buco with risotto. This was done to perfection, the risotto was cooked fantastically and the marrow of the bone was delish. My boyfriend got the ciopinno special and he loved it as well. Hats off to the chef!  Will I be back? I dunno. For the food and service, sure but not with a coupon apparently.

Out of town on business looking for a place close to my hotel for a nice dinner. Tripped up on this little gem and totally felt welcome as a single woman dining out. I have the special of the evening and it was fantastic. Wine selection was nice however if you were a white wine drinker you might find selections limited. Service was very attentive. A bit pricey compared to other Italian restaurants in the area

Bought the current Groupon and was excited to try this much "talked about" restaurant. Needless to say I was thoroughly disappointed. The hostess greeted me and asked how many in my party? I answered four, two adults, two children. After finding out my children were young, she asked me if I would like to be put in a corner. I promptly responded,  "No, why?" She said, "Well kids run around, scream, and can be disruptive." I said, "Well, my kids behave so I'm not really worried." Then, if that wasn't enough, she stated, "I just don't want you to be embarrassed." Oh my! That was just the beginning. The waiter, Angel, was condescending and did not offer any help when it came to the kids' selections. We ended up paying $16.00 per plate for spaghetti yet the adult portion was $18.95. Talk about a big rip off! We ended up paying $20.00 per child which included drinks. There was a gentleman circulating amongst guests but never said boo to us. The food was not extraordinary as previous reviews have stated. There are many Italian restaurants to be insulted and eat marginal food! We will NEVER be back!

So i decided to stop here for a late night meal with a friend after a workout anout 40 min before they closed. First look in i realized i wasnt dressed properly but a server sat us anyways after giving us the are u serious look wearing jean shorts and a fight hoodie in here... lol I liked our server Danny even though we could tell he wasnt excited to be getting a table this late but he gave us a great menu rap, accent and all. I appreciated his enthousiasm even if it was a little forced. We ordered a glass of wine and a beer and they dropped off bread service for us. Bread was a bit tasteless and not exciting. 3  different types but pretty plain. When our food came out i was happy with my spagetti and meatballs, (was craving carbs after workout) good flavor and just enough sauce for me. The spagetti noodles where done perfect as well. She ordered the bolangese and enjoyed it but likes more sauce with her pasta. Daniel came to check on us and she said she was fine but he could tell she wasnt really happy so he asked her whats up and she mentioned she likes more sauce in here pastas but it was no big deal. He told her to hold on a moment and he would take care of it and moments later they sent out a small dish of piping hot sauce. No attitude or problems, just answers. That impresses us both the most. He didnt sacrifice service because of how late it was or how we were dressed. We will definetly be back just based on service and how good our entree dishes were. Great all around experience.

My wife and I went there yesterday (A Monday) and sat at the bar for drinks and dinner.  We decided to go at an earlier time than usual and we got there about 20 mins after opening.   Mr Gaetano greeted us as we entered and asked if we would like a table or sit at the bar, we sat at the bar and was greeted by Alex (a new barman) who was very friendly and knowledgeable of the drinks and menu. We had a scampi appetizer which was cooked perfectly in a lemon and pepper sauce, it was fantastic, at no point did we feel rushed to order something else we just sat and chatted at the bar while Alex stopped by only to refill our glasses. Our main course arrived, my wife had the cheese filled ravioli and the pasta was wafer thin and tasted great.  I had the Penne with Bolognese which was fantastic, the pasta was cooked perfectly and the Bolognase gravy was to die for. All in all a great experience, we had been before but kinda forgot about it, now we have been again it will be one of our regular spots to have a nice early dinner.

My husband and I came here for a date night and had some of the best Italian food we have ever had!!! I had the clam pasta and wanted to drink the sauce it was so good!! We also had the creme brule, and it was the best I have ever had. Awesome service and welcoming atmosphere!
Amazing Italian food in Vegas. Really has a NY feel and the atmosphere in here is perfect for dates!

While in Las Vegas for business, a friend recommended this restaurant. Loved it! Food was great, service was first-class, and the atmosphere was very relaxing and quiet (a welcome diversion from the loud sights and sounds of Vegas).   The waiter was informative about the menu and very helpful in making our choices amongst all the great-sounding meals. There are familiar dishes on the menu...and some very unique as well. I had a creamy pumpkin soup (with the spices just right), and fish cooked perfectly with a light, yet flavorful sauce. The wines were varied, and my very affordable Cabernet was rich and smooth.   This is the type of restaurant, that if I lived nearby, I can see it becoming a regular!

Fantastic!!!!!!!!! It was my gf 's birthday and she wanted some fresh homemade pasta.  I did a little research and found Gaetano's on Yelp. They make their own Fettuchini and ravioli. I believe they may also make some other noodles but I'm not sure.   We were seated with one of the best waiters we've had in quite some time. His name is Jake. He was very knowledgable about the menu and helped us to make some selections which enabled us to try a number of different items from the menu without having to order 3-4 dinners. He also was pretty funny and made us laugh.   On to the food..... We ordered the grilled portabello mushroom appetizer which had a great smokey grilled taste and just the right amount of cheese. Delicious!!!! Next came our caesar salad for 2. The homemade caesar dressing is perfect. The appetizers and salads were also served with a lovely warm bread assortment with olive oil and balsamic vineger to dip into. Our main couses arrived a short time later...............Cioppino with homemade fettucini noodles and an order of assorted homemade ravioli. We also got a meatball on the side.   Gaetano and his wife both came by our table to be sure all was well and we were enjoying our meals. That's rare and much appreciated when the owners of a restaurant care enough to make contact with their customers.  This was a great first visit to Gaetano's and everthing was fantastic.!!!!!!!!!!!  We will definitely be returning to Gaetano's again for dinner.

I brought my GF here for her birthday and I was not disappointed, First off the waiter was simply impressive and even cooler was that the house Manhattan was named after him and was a great drink. I had the special that night which was a pork dish and was fantastic, I have never heard of the dish but with the vegetables it was great. It came with gnocchi which I didn't feel like eating so they easily switched it out with pasta.  The fresh bread they serve is DELISH and the house salads are amazing. Oh and if you are not impressed that the server remembers 11 different daily specials on a daily basis then I do not know what to say.

This food is A-MA-ZING!  I love their lasagna and chicken parmigiana!  My husband gets rigatoni bolognese!  Their sauce is tasty with tang but not greasy.  The lasagna is made with a béchamel sauce rather than chunky ricotta, but I love it this way!   We order takeout and have a delicious homemade Italian meal!

Little underwhelming for the prices and portion size The mussels were just as expensive as Maestros and there wasn't anything in the shell tiny mussels not enough  Shells were cracked wrong when they were opened  I let the waiter know and he didn't show any interest  I almost broke a tooth on the shell  The manager went over to every table except ours it was our anniversary and the bill was big for not getting full  Chicken parm was like 27.00  Here's a good joke chicken parm you didn't taste so good lol  1st and Italian restaurant I've left still hungry  They think they're upscale problem is they're not  I gave it 2 stars because the servers buss boys were attentive  The waiter Angel was rude and obnoxious  I will look for another Italian restaurant in the area to enjoy not impressed .....

Everything about Gaetano's was amazing. Jacob - our server - was very relaxed, professional, full of great suggestions & an over really nice guy.  The food was delightful. From the selections of breads to the fettuccine, it was everything we hoped for & more.  Thank you for an amazing evening. Jacob was fantastic & we very much look forward to returning.

Very disappointing.  We went because we had been before and had a good experience, but this was definitely not the case this time.  When we received our order we realized that one of the dishes was not what we expected.  Also the Penne Pasta with Vodka sauce also was almost impossible to eat because it was too salty.  We spoke to the waiter and the owner came over.  He was insistent that this was how it was and cared less about what we were saying.   He was rude and obnoxious.  He will never have our business again!

The ambiance is beautiful....dimmed lights, Italian themed soft music playing, comfortable seating with clean tables. Service was very tentative. But the food was just average at best. Nothing memorable. And I've been here twice before I decide to write this review. Only reason why we decide to give Gaetano's a second chance was because of that soon to expire Groupon.  With my first visit, I got a pasta dish with just straight up pesto sauce. Gross. So yesterday evening....I got the Rigatoni Alla Bolognese-pasta with homemade meat sauce. It was a safe choice but really just A-OK. Sadly...it tasted like a Lean Cuisine frozen dinner. =/ However, my boyfriend really enjoyed his crusted seabass entrée with a side of meat sauce penne. The fish was fresh and that wine sauce was pretty good. This was part of the 5+ specials for the night.  Maybe third times the charm? Until then....three stars it is.  But I will update this review (hopefully bump up instead of bump down) if we ever go back here again. I would like to try the Chicken Piccata. Although...there's another really good Italian restaurant close by. *ahemmontesano*

This place is a piece of crap. First of all, me and my wife are in our early 70's, don't drink alcohol, and we can not eat a lot of food. So, we came with a coupon that was buy one entree, get the second entree for half price. The food is good, no complaint there. Then when we were presented with the check, the waiter did not add the coupon, so the owner came to the table and said, "You people come here with a coupon, you don't eat an appetize, you didn't even drink any wine....don't ever come back to my place again."  I have never been treated so badly by anyone, anywhere, ever. Then, the owner followed us out to the parking lot yelling at us and once again, said, "Get the FU%& out of here and don't ever come back." You simply can not make this stuff up. Countless people I know who have dined here have gotten a very cold and rude experience as well. Below, they describe the wife who is like a gate keeper. SHAME ON THE OWNER FOR TREATING PEOPLE SO BADLY. IF YOU TREATED PEOPLE WITH RESPECT, YOU WOULN'T HAVE TO GIVE OUT COUPONS TO BRING PEOPLE THROUGH YOUR DOOR. ALSO, IF YOU DON'T WANT PEOPLE USING GROUPONS OR COUPONS, STOP OFFERING THEM. THESE PEOPLE ARE HORRIBLE.

Enjoyed the ambiance and decor of the place. We ordered the Venison steak special for $38, the pasta figoli, and crab cake, and then the Chicken Parmesan.   I really wanted to like the place because it would be nice to have off the strip options for a decent meal but I have to say that it was underwhelming. The food itself was not bad but it wasnt anything special either. I think some more imagination and flavor would go a long way.   Worse than that, the portion sizes were just small. $12 for a crab cake appetizer, I'd expect to see two crab cakes not just one little one in the middle of the plate.   My venison dish was fine but only maybe 4 or 5 slices (small slices) of Venison on top of a scoop of Risotto? For $38? To me that's even worse than strip prices. Maybe it was that way for Valentine's Day but shocking as it is, it's much better value for the money to go down to Buddy V's or to Maggiannos and the food at either place is much better, too.

FANTASTICO!!  awesome fresh warm bread, flavorful calimari! I had the chicken ravioli with pesto sauce and my only complaint is that I wanted more I never wanted it to end! Oh and their terimisu wow dont even get me started I dont think I opened my eyes the whole time i was eating it from how beautifuly orgasmic it was...the atmosphere was great, family vibe and super authentic italian staff, definitely going back no doubt :D

Went for valentine day but not sure if it was because of the constricted and specially selected menu that we were not able to experience the full bit of Gaetano's offerings.  We were limited to certain items and I gravitated to pasta while the hubs wanted steak. Steak in an Italian place...hm not such a great idea I feel.  Service was very slow, i expected better staffing on this special day.  We sat at a corner with two tables and water finally came after a good 5 minutes.  Took a longer time to get bread and then everything was pretty much acceptable once entree arrived.  Bread was SO delicious....so soft, warm, crunch on the side but not too hard.  Loved it.  The only gripe....the balsamic vinegar. Was it stuck to the bottom of bowl? Olive oil was good but that balsamic adds flavor and I had to dig out the balsamic with my bread, the most work I had to do while dressed up with perfectly manicured nails.  That darn balsamic...all that scraping and that's all I got!  It was worth it though once I got it because that bread was ust divine.  The pasta with mushroom and filet tasted well, very creamy and I was filled just with about three or four fork fulls.  I equated it to Beef Stroganoff with much better flavoring when pepper added.  I would order again, but prepare to box it home. So very rich and creamy.  The steak was dry. We asked for medium and it was cooked medium well...more on the dry side.  I enjoyed the mash and spinach very much...which is quite odd since the steak should have been the highlight.  We had to mix the mash with meat to palate it down.    Let's redeem with creme brulee and we were so disappointed.  The consistency was rough, it was oozing out and we were basically slurping creme brulee vs. having a nice firm dollop on spoon.  We didn't complain since they seemed so busy and we were not sure if we would return....so it's on to another venue to relive how creme brulee should taste like..  I think they took it out too early from fridge (the oozing part) and the preparation of custard was not well executed (hence the grainy texture of the creme). Thank goodness for a nice crackle of sugar on top..that was perfectly fired.

Met my friend who had a Groupon. I just moved to Henderson & want to find new spots & this was a perfect way to test the waters. The food was fabulous...we shared 2 specials...Chilean sea bass & rolled pork...both were great! The portions were huge!  Our waiter was wonderful...had fun talking to him as he was from Michigan originally as both of us...all in all well be back!!! Can't wait to have that sea bass again!!! Delish!!!!

My husband and I thought we would try a new restaurant. This place was a huge let down! Owners walk around patrolling the waiters and stopping at only select tables. Food was meh. Caesar salad tasted like bagged salad. Pasta was over cooked and tastes like boxed pasta. Funny the only time the lady owner came to our table was to collect the check. I overheard her telling one of the waiters not to give anything extra only what's on the table. I assumed she was talking about us since we asked for extra bread and oil. She is very rude. The food is way overpriced and taste more like Olive Garden. Menu is boring. I see why only a few tables were filled on a Friday night. Save your money! Way better options in Henderson!

We were first introduced to this restaurant through some good friends and have returned time and time again since then. We just celebrated our 3rd Anniversary here and hope to keep visiting for all our special occasions. This family owned and operated Italian restaurant is amazing. Everyone is extremely friendly and treats everyone as if they've known you forever. The owner, Gaetano Palmeri, is always walking around to ask if your dining experience is good and will even go over the daily specials personally. His family is very nice and you can't find a better personality than, Danny! The food is amazing! The Seafood/Pasta special (I always forget the name...) is my favorite. The Crab stuffed Salmon, Stuffed Lamb Chop and veal are awesome too. The have a great wine list and also host a monthly wine dinner pairing that is great. It's not Olive Garden or Carrabbas, so expect to pay a little more but it won't break you.

We went there to celebrate my husband's birthday -   What a wonderful experience!  The atmosphere was warm and welcoming.  The service was impeccable and the owner stopped by our table a time or two to make sure everything was all right.  The food was out of this world (from the bread, main course and dessert).  We will definitely be going back.  Thank you to everyone @ Gaetano's Ristorante for making my husbands birthday memorable...
Food was amazing. Portion sizes were perfect for the price. Not a place for children.

This was my first visit to this restaurant. It is a beautiful place. The service was very good Jake was our waiter and he did a good job. However the salads that we had were little bit on the small side as portions go. I had filet mignon with the homemade noodles .The homemade noodles were very good but it didn't taste like filet mignon and the meat was overdone and it looked like ground beef. We ordered artichoke hearts they were the worst artichoke hearts I've had in my life. Artichoke hearts and not supposed to have leaves attached to them and ours did. I told the waiter and he quickly blamed it on the new guy in the back. I told him it's not the new guy in the back it's whoever trained him is the problem.

Bought a Groupon, got $40 for $20. Meal was fine, restaurant was a little empty. Service so-so, we waited a long time for our server to take our order. Lasagna made from fresh pasta - delicious but fresh pasta makes the lasagna more "soft" and "mushy" - missing the bite of al dente from dried pasta. Fresh pasta with 3 Ps had amazing flavor of porcini. It's an incredibly rich dish.   Creme Brûlée spot on.   Prices are expensive, not sure if go there again without the Groupon.
The best Italian food in the Valley!  You must try the Special Cap drink, yum!  Ray is the best bartender, he is so polite and attentive.

MMMMMMMM!!! thats all i have to say about this place. i could say for a Saturday night they could have a bit more servers working, but it acutally ended up working out. cuz with all the food we ordered the time it took for it to come out was just the right amount to let us rest in between.  sooo good, will def be back!!

We've been going to Gaetanos since it opened. It's truly one of the BEST Italian restaurants I've had the privilege to enjoy many times. We have been dining there for so long, we have become friends with the owners. The service is truly impeccable every time. They have daily gourmet specials, along with the regular authentic Italian menu. Their food is always very good. I also love their occasional tasting dinners. The prices are very reasonable. Make it a point to dine here, even if you're just visiting. You won't be disappointed.

We visited for the first time on a Friday night.   I came with my mom, husband, and my toddler. I would definitely say that this is a great date night place, but not really for young families! We had great service until our food arrived, then our server kind of went missing.   The owners (I assume) were very kind and came around asking how things were and were awesome! My husband went outside with our son and the owner took my husbands food to the kitchen and reheated it for him.   No kids menu available here.   They did bring out the food quickly though!

This is our favorite neighborhood restaurant. The service and the food is impeccable. Never disappoints. The 3 P's is to die for also the pappardelle fillete. Gaetano greets you as if you were a regular.

GREAT Food!  GREAT Service!  Have been here before and have always enjoyed our experience.  Figured I might as well Yelp about this time.  Had Dinner last night... it was pretty empty ... 3 other tables were sat when we got there... of course, one table did have 10 people at it.  Ambience:  Quiet (unless there's a party of 10 whooping it up next to you)... can be Romantic / Intimate with the low lighting...white table cloths and stealthy servers Not Fancy... but Not Casual...   We had brought our own bottle of Prosecco to enjoy at the beginning of the meal and to toast my Mom's b-day.  I think the corkage fee was $15.  They immediately brought out Chilled Flutes and a bucket filled with ice to keep our wine cold....and they continued to refill our glasses til the wine was gone.  :)    We ordered the Bruschetta to start.... Pretty good... because the tomatoes were juicy... the bread got soggy.  Not the best Bruschetta I've ever had but it was good... give it 3 stars.  My mom and I split the Arugula salad (with goat cheese, pear slivers and candied pecans and a light champagne vinigarette).   5 stars Perfect portion to split as we wanted a salad but didn't want a BIG salad to start.  Very tasty... fresh arugula and the the goat cheese was melt in your mouth perfect.  I ordered the Special Stuffed Veal Chop... WOW!  WOW!  WOW!   5 stars! It was D-LISH!  And the veal chop was HUGE.  I didn't finish it... took half home.  It was served with parmesan risotto of which... I took 1/2 of that home too. The chop was stuffed with parm, broccoli rabe, italian sausage and served in their Marsala sauce... SO GOOD!  Mom ordered the Crab Stuffed Salmon which was served on a bed of rice pilaf, sliced carrots and zucchini. I got a taste of hers and it was Very Good... but I liked my stuffed Veal Chop better. I'd give hers 4.5 stars because I liked mine better.  The husband ordered the Special Pappardelle pasta with Filet Mignon and Shittake mushrooms in a Creamy Marsala sauce.  I got a taste of this too... WOW!  Definitely 5 stars! It was rich and so much flavor. The shittake really added another dimension to the dish... of flavor and depth. I really liked his but was enjoying my veal so much that I didn't switch with him... although... I thought about it. Sadly, he ate ALL of his dinner so I don't get his leftovers.  Because it was Mom's b-day... they brought out Tiramisu.   YUMMMMM! 5 stars Light... Creamy.... Rich.  Not overly soaked in coffee ... and Not overly sugar-y.... One of the best Tiramisu's I've had.  My favorite is still the one at Celini's in New York but this one makes top 5.  Will I go back?  YES!

I use Groupon to find restaurants every where I travel, even in my own city (there's so many) this one is a gem! The waiter Alex was nice & extremely professional! His knowledge of the menu was awesome and the way he described the selections made you want to try everything! We looked at the menu & had our meals picked, but when Alex returned he gave us the rundown of the daily specials, it changed everything! My son ordered the duck came with butternut ravioli, I ordered the sausage ravioli in mushroom sauce, both dishes were delightful! The whole dinner starting with the variety of hot breads to dessert was so delicious & the tiramisu don't skip it, melts in your mouth! We will be back!
If you are looking for great authentic Italian food. This is the place Every meal has been fantastic. Reasonable priced Great service Very clean.

My husband and I had been there for Valentines' Day and loved it. So we jumped at a Groupon offer and reserved for this past Saturday night - a couple we know well wanted to takes us for a birthday dinner. We gave them our Groupon to ease the cost a bit. My husband asked about using the Groupon - which apparently was a mistake because the attention we got vanished.  We received our soups and salads quickly as well as the bread baskets. All good. But then we started to wait. We asked for another bread basket - we were brought burnt bread. Awhile went by and asked for another - we were having good conversation and didn't really notice the time. Second basket even worse. It occurred to me - how long has it been? Turned out it had been 45 minutes since the salad. No wonder we were hungry! I mentioned it to my tablemates. They said they were sure the entree wiuld be served soon. Five minutes later, I noticed people who came in after us were eating. I went to the hostess and asked. She checked and said, "It will be soon now. He forgot to put in the order and it had just been fired". So we would have just sat there all night if I hadn't said something. It didn't occur to anyone that we were sitting there with NO FOOD and there might be something wrong. The hostess said they would give us free desserts. I didn't want their dessert, I like to go to Cream for ice cream. My group, though, said okay. The entrees were very tasty, my friend loved the mezzaluna and we liked our pasta. After the meal, my husband said we would just have two desserts and asked what they had on offer. No, the hostess told us, they would bring something out. One cheesecake, one tiramisu. Everybody in our group hates coffee flavor, only one liked the cheesecake. It was weird - if they were trying to make it up to us, shouldn't we have been asked what we wanted to have? For the record, we tip on the full amount of the meal, not the discounted price, since we are retired from the restaurant business. This was obviously not everyone's experience, but it was ours. The level of hostility from the crew was palpable as we left, like it was OUR fault. Maybe because they still had more burnt bread in the kitchen they wanted to get rid of.

Updated to include dinner New Year's Eve at Gaetano's.   The Ossobuco was absolutely  fantastic.   Very tender, very flavorful and of course the marrow is the crowning glory.   Missed the traditional gremolata (garlic/parsley/lemon zest sprinkled over the shanks) but other than that it was perfect.  It was served over pasta, but again being the traditionalist when it comes to Ossobuco I asked for and got Risotto Milanese and it too was perfect.   Two others in my group ordered the same and they loved it. I love that the owner always makes it a point to talk to the patrons and maybe josh with them a little.  He always makes himself visible and available and if you need anything, or make substituions he's there and ready to accomodate. Nice touch.

This was my 2nd visit last night and we had a party of 10 for a birthday.  I was very impressed with the food on my first visit, all except for the Caesar Salad (did not care for the dressing) on the first visit.  But the food was amazing.  Our service was perfect....and everyone had very positive comments on the food.  For me...this is one of the best and most authentic Italian Restaurants in Las Vegas, and if you know the family history, they used to be in Calabasas before coming to Las Vegas in I believe 2002.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.   When I read the review from a Colleen F stating that she thought Carrabba's was cheaper with more flavor....I had to laugh and think to myself...poor girl has no idea what beautiful Italian food is all about.   It was like comparing a Pinto to a Mercedes.  I cannot wait to go back there again!

Like many of the other reviews, I took advantage of the Restaurant.com offer.  You get $50 off but need to spend $100.    My advice is to wait when they offer 80 or 90% off the Restaurant.com offer.  Normally you can get the $50 coupon for $20 but they offer discounts and then you can get it for just a couple bucks.  Onto the review....  I love this place because of the food and service.  You really feel at home and it does not feel stuffy.   The owner comes by and talks to you about the dishes and gives every table attention.    We ordered  the following:  Carpaccio di manzo con arugula - Thin slices of raw beef tenderloin with arugula, parmesan cheese, and EVOO.  This was very light and fresh.  Butternut squash Ravioli with Brown butter and Sage  - Very fresh...pasta had that nice bite in texture and the sauce was the boss.  You can also order a smaller portion which is what we did so these were our 2 apps.  Branzino Served Tableside - This was one of the off-the-menu items.  As stated in previous reviews, the restaurant typicaly has 8-10 daily specials.  I recommend def ordering one of them up.  The fish was simple but fresh and good.  A little lemon, EVOO brings out the freshness and taste of the fish.    Ossobucco served on saffron risotto - the best dish i ve had in months.  so much flavor and you can tell some old lady's been slaving away cooking it in a dutch oven to get all the nice, juicy flavor.  You don't need a knife for the shank and it's so rich but worth it.  The risotto is perfectly cooked.  To round it out, we ordered a side of broccoli rabe, tiramisu (awesome!), coffee, and with tax and tip we were out the door for just under $80.  For the quality of food and service, the meal would have been close to $200 on the strip, but with the coupon we had a great time for a very reasonable price.  We'll be back fo sure!

Gaetano's has a very pleasant and relaxing atmosphere.   The staff was very knowledgeable of menu items and provided good service.    I ordered the asparagus risotto special.  The risotto was delicious and well seasoned.  The restaurant could have stepped it up a little and put a garnish of grilled asparagus or something to make the dish visually appealing.   My husband had the rolled pork special.  The flavor was OK.  He gave me a bite of the pork.  You could hardly taste the pork as it was overwhelmed by the amount of bread stuffing inside.  The sauce should have been nappe and it was overly thick.  This was a little disappointing which is why we took away one star.  Overall though, it was a good experience and we would probably go back.  The restaurant was a  little pricey for the quality of food served.

So not really Italian....and soooo overpriced and the atmosphere is almost non-existent....parking is horrible....using a voucher from Restaurant.com takes a bit of the bite of how not wonderful this place is.  The owner circulate among the guests but only talk to their croonies.  I live in Henderson NV where this restaurant is.

This ristorante boasts very good food with a few unique dishes that set it apart from the usual Italian fare. From the obligatory pre-meal bread to the delightful dessert cappucino, everything was fresh, tasty, and interesting. The service, setting, and presentation were all excellent as well. Though a little pricey, I would definitely recommond this place for a nice night out.
Great Italian place! Cozy and romantic ambience with top notch service! Chicken Parm and Picatta were excellent! Nice bread and impressive wine list by the bottle or glass.

Food was super delicious!  Our waiter Zack was awesome.  He gave great suggestions on the stuffed figs wrapped in prochutt.  We finished our meal with Gaetanos special espresso which was the perfect ending.  Will definitely come back.

I have been going to this place for many years now and I cannot tell you how upset and surprised we were with the treatment we received last night. My family and I live in Las Vegas so taking the time to drive to this place should tell you how much we used to enjoy going there, however last night when greeted by the owner at the entrance, we will never go back and will absolutely spread the word on how this man operates.  As we entered at 6pm we noticed only two patrons in the place they were at the bar.  The owner greeted us and promptly proceeded to offend  us from there on out.  We had our 6 month old sleeping baby with us in his car seat and the owner when going to seat us walked us through the bar area which is rather narrow and put us directly in the back of the restaurant to the side of the doors of which there was one lone table. Now mind you the restaurant was totally empty,  except for the two people at the bar. We asked why were were being seated away from the main dining room, and in the back by the bathroom doors and he said because we had the baby.  He said I don't want crying kids and noisy things making noise and neither does anyone else.  I cannot tell you how rude this was not too mention discriminatory .  I have been to 5 star restaurants every where and have never been treated so rudely. Not only was the baby sleeping but the restaurant was empty! We teach our children how to behave in restaurants from an early age, we always respect the feelings and wishes of other dinner patrons by walking outside with a crying child. How dare this man assume we are some sort of second class folk because we brought our baby with us.  We were humiliated and treated very poorly.  It was like a scene right out of 50s, you know like the times where people of color were segregated from whites because it was offensive to mingle the two together.     Needless to say we did not stay we just said no thanks and left he was all to happy to say bye.    Shame shame on this man for setting us back 70 years and not treating everyone as equals. We will never go back there no matter how the food tastes and I would hope that others do the same.   He himself is an immigrant and or an offspring of immigrant parents and should be mindful of everyone who lives here in this great country of the United States of America and stop discriminating against anyone of any type.   Bad for business Mr Gaetano I hope karma comes a knocking at your door with an iron fist!
Wonderful food. Had stuffed veal with parmesan risotto, fried artichokes with a pesto sauce. A-freaking-mazing. Papa- the owner was very wonderful with us.

I was very surprised that Gaetano's has another location other than in Torrance, Calif. So for those in Henderson, you are in for a wonderful treat. I HIGHLY recommend their "Wild mushroom ravioli and tiramisu", seriously heavenly!
Gaetano's has AMAZING food! The service was great too. The owner waited on us and his wife worked at the door. I love that atmosphere!

Walked in at 9:17 and some stuck up old man tells us " not sure if we have time to serve you.." they close at 10.. After ordering our food bread shows up, be sure to have doubles there because the portions are very small! The food was nothing to write home about... save your money there are way better places out there with out the attitude..

I don't venture down to Henderson much...by choice...but I am glad I met this girl in a coffee shop.  If I hadn't I would have missed a great Italian Restaurant.  The atmosphere is top notch.  Every place setting was perfectly laid out, and the tables were close enough to be intimate but not so close that you were rubbing elbows with strangers.  The calamari was tender and breaded to perfection.  The 75 dollar tasting menu with matching wines is exactly what all tasting menus should be.  Lots of food, thoughtfully prepared with exceptional ingredients.  The wines were exceptional and complimented the food to a tee.  Great for dates, romantic without being TOO romantic.  I say this is an excellent place for a group of adults, a first date or a married couple out for a nice meal but don't want to spend 150 a person.  The wait staff was attentive without being overbearing and they answered every question my date had.  Highly recommended.

Wow this place totally redeemed itself on this vist! I went with the boar Ragu I can't remember the Italian name for it but it was incredibly good as it was a daily special. As for the appetizer we got the antipasto platter which was loaded with sliced Meats cheeses and eggplant that was marinated. Service was on point and the ambience of the restaurant is really quite nice. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes.

Of course the food is wonderful.  Beyond that, I just love how they treat me here, especially as a single lady dining alone. Talk about transformational service! And, my LivingSocial voucher made it doubly good!
Just had dinner, they have great raviolis really enjoyed it great service would highly recommend it to anyone.

My family has been here before and they said it was amazing, so I figured I would try it with them! As soon as you walk in you feel "at home".  Very cozy and adorable layout! We were seated right away without any reservations which was great.  We were greeted very quickly and were given bread right away.  Their bread is baked fresh daily and you can definitely tell.  Our waiter told us the daily specials and they sounded delicious.    I had the fillet of Sole with a side of butternut squash ravioli ( my weakness) and my family had bolognese pasta, a spicy pasta, and veal parmesan.  Everything looked beautiful when it came out and their portions are very big and sharing sizes.  The fish was very fresh (which is rare lol no ocean)   Unfortunately I had room for dessert although they sounded so good!  I can't wait to come back to this restaurant and try new items off the menu.  One of the better italian places in Vegas off the strip!

Excellent experience and the food was delicious! We met the owner, Gaetano and his son - they go out of there way to make an evening at their restaurant so warm and inviting, as if you're dining in their home. We're locals and it's one of our favorite hangouts. . . Buon appetito!

We gave Gaetano's 2 tries. We thought the first time was a fluke. We were wrong. This time around, the service was below average and the food was nothing special. We could have spent less and had more flavor at Carrabba's. I ordered the lasagna. It was a nice size portion, but the sauce was very watery.  My husband ordered the special, chicken and asparagus risotto. It was extremely bland....we were trying to spice it up by scooping up my watered-down sauce onto it. We would have liked to try some fresh mozzarella or parmersean on it, but our server only checked on us about a minute after we got our food. We never saw him again until it was time for the check.   We really wanted to like this place since it's got a great ambiance and is so close to our house. But we won't be back.

I went here with a groupon on a Monday night and it was a ghost town. Idk y because this place was the bizzzz!!! My cioppino was perfect, my fiancé s vongole was delish,  the carppacio was divine.  They had great customer service and super helpful with the menu...I love this place!!!
If you are ever in the area Gaetano's is a must! Worth the Uber trip from the strip.  The food was outstanding and the service impeccable. Family run place where quality and service is top rate.

My family went here for my Birthday this year, opting for something different than the usual 4 star strip restaurant we typically do to celebrate. I've had my eye on this place for awhile and it met every expectation, the staff was amazing and the food was even better. We all had something different and shared a bit of each others since everyone's food looked amazing! We also tried multiple appetizers which were also fantastic. It was late and we were the last patrons in the restaurant, no one attempted to rush us as we lingered and chatted and even opened gifts. Was a overall fabulous experience and will definitely be back again.

Definitely a change of pace from typical Italian Restaurants. Gaetano's has an excellent selection and nightly specials, prepared to perfection. Gaetano's has a wide variety of wines on their menu and something to go with anything!  The food is served hot and fresh. It is unique and delicious. Their seafood plates are outstanding, as well as the pasta dishes.  The service is five star! And the hospitality is fantastic. We are going there again tonight to celebrate my daughter's birthday. When asked where she wanted to go? She said "Gaetano's!   Enjoy!
This place is highly recommended! I always order gnocchi's with the Gorgonzola dressing delicious! The owner is always there very pleasant inviting place.
Great restaurant with a nice ambiance, excellent food and stellar service.  It was even better that we had a groupon but it would have still been worth it without it!

Ive given this place two chances now and find it hard to write much as the place is just so so. Ambience is lackluster. Food is average while wine menu isnt half bad (they do allow byob with modest corkage but check ahead of time bc they wont allow your bottle if its on their menu).
Possibly the best family owned restaurant in Henderson. I continue to be impressed by their service and the quality of their food after all these years. They've got it right..

This place is awesome!  From the ambience, service, food quality to the prices, it was fantastic.    Purchased on groupon and had 2 amazing plates, a glass of wine and some bread.  I will be back for sure.  My mother liked it very much and can't stop speaking about it.

This is a hidden jewel!  Small Italian restaurant with some great house specials.  I had the seabass which was light-flaky and buttery!  Delish!!!   Tip:  Make reservations!!!!  It small so seating is limited.  Dress is not formal but it inst casual either.  Great for date night!!

My wife and I tried this place with a Groupon. We were the only two in the restaurant at 5:30. The menu in simple and limited, which is usually a good thing. I had the veal and my wife had butternut squash ravioli. My veal and pasta were good but I was overwhelmed with the amount of grease. My wife's really enjoyed her ravioli but the was nothing else on the plate. The service was pretty good. Almost too good. Every other sip of my drink, there was someone filling it up. We lost track of how many people were coming to our table. It was a bit much. The thing that upset me was the bill. We had a $40 Groupon and the bill was about $55. They added a group gratuity of almost ten dollars to the bill. I would have tipped way more than the $10 because that's what you do when you use a Groupon. When someone adds a tip because you use a coupon, that's their tip. Too bad for them. Overall a decent restaurant will decent service and food. This must not be a very popular restaurant if they are using Groupon and then telling money from their customers. I will not be returning to this establishment. Overall, an ok restaurant. Decent service and decent food. The price

This is most possibly the best Italian food I have ever eaten . The staff is friendly.  It is a family owned  business and the food is phenomenal. Gaetano himself seats you and his beautiful wife greets you.  Well worth it . Best dining experience ever. Our waiter was a rock star very knowledgeable.  Went out of his way to make sure we had an excellent experience.
Great wine good pizza. Prices ok. I would recommend for dinner date. Loud at the bar, bartender nice and attentive.

First time at Gaetano's the other night and it was a pleasant surprise. This family run restaurant can trace its roots back to LA four decades ago. And the rich history shows in how this restauranteur and his family treat you from the moment you walk in to your departure. When I think of fine dining off the strip in Las Vegas, few places come to mind but Gaetano's is one.  The atmosphere is fantastic. Spacious, comfortable seating and a great vibe, you are relaxed and eager to experience the menu at Gaetano's. The bar is a good place to start with a cocktail or glass of wine. Once at the table Gaetano does a great job of walking you through the specials of the night, of which there were plenty. Before looking at the menu you already have several dishes you absolutely want to taste.  The menu itself is full of Italian classics - chicken parm, Osso Bacco, veal Milanese, and a host of amazing sounding pasta dishes. I went with the Osso Bacco served with Safran risotto. It was perfect. We started with the buffalo mozzarella which paired well with the home baked bread basket. The special Mediterranean salad was also very good, freshly prepared and seasoned tossed style.   Gaetano's food is exceptional however where he really demonstrates his high caliber cuisine is in the range and quality of his desert menu. One after another the selection is classic Italiano but prepared to Gaetano's family signature style. We ordered several deserts to share and they were fabulous.   I'm glad we came to Gaetano's. It's going to be a regular spot for me when looking to dine out in Henderson.

This was the worst dining experience ever the food was terrible and the service was horrible!  My wife and I went there and the owner told us off because we split a meal,  Furthermore, he told my wife and I to never come back, we are senior citizens and on a fixed income . The whole experience was absolutely awful, what kind of person chases after customers and says don't come back if you're going to split a meal.

I visited this establishment on April Fool's Day, 2013, to redeem a Groupon I had purchased over a year ago; needless to say, the promotional value had expired hehe  The decor and layout was upscale and I was instantly impressed.  I was seated at a corner table between the bar and the dining area which turned out to be a very high traffic area for the servers.  There were people flying behind me throughout the evening, putting orders in at the bar and returning with drinks.  I should have asked for a different seat.    I ordered the "Trancia di Salmone alla Senape," (Pan seared filet of salmon with shallots and a dijon mustard sauce) which, if you're looking at the menu is the 2nd item at the top on a right hand page.  I pointed directly at the item I wanted and even attempted to pronouce it lol  (that was fun!)  10-15 minutes later, the server returns and states he forgot to ask how I wanted the meat prepared.  This should have been a red flag!  However, I was taken aback as I've never had anyone ask me how I'd like my salmon cooked.  I quickly replied, "Well done."  He looked back at me, almost shocked, and asked, "So you don't want any red in it?"  I replied, definitely not.  15 minutes later or so, the server returns and apologizes for the wait, stating the meat takes longer to prepare well done.  I understood and was astonishingly patient.    My food finally arrives after 30 minutes or so, and I looked at the meat and it looked burnt.  I thought, "Oh... this is what well done salmon looks like. " I began to eat and noticed the meat was good but definitely WAS NOT fish.  I had no more than 3 bites and called the server back and politely asked, "Is this salmon?"  He replied, "Oh, I thought you ordered the steak filet?"  I quickly grabbed the menu and re-pointed to what I had previously ordered.  He asked if I wanted to keep the food as he went back to order what I had asked for.  I replied, "No thank you" and he took the filet mignon back.    Five minutes later, the owner is in my face.  He was rude and was like, "How can you not tell the difference between salmon and steak?!  I mean, their two different kinds of meat!"  He was pissed and I would be too however the fact that he came at me accusatory and rude left a hugely sour taste in my mouth.  He basically came across as if I had ordered one thing and then changed my mind once the food arrived.  What was brought to me was way at the bottom of the same page I ordered from so there should have been no confusion.  Had it not been for the server ADMITTING his fault, the owner would have continued to verbally assault me.  I should have been more embarrassed by the situation, but, as they walked away, all I could do was laugh because I knew I had nothing to do with the mix up.  It was the way the owner handled the situation that cemented my decision to never to eat at this establishment again, even though the food was delicious.  30 minutes later, my salmon arrived.    The icing on the cake was when they charged me AUTOGRATUITY, totalling $5.84.  The service certainly did not warrant such a tip and the fact that the owner made NO attempt to remedy the hour long wait for my food or his rudeness was beyond poor customer service.  In closing, if Groupon was giving away free $40 vouchers to eat at Gaetano's, I would, without question, have to decline.  Good food must never trump great service; and if the poor service I received that night was an April Fool's joke, I definitely was not amused!  You've been warned =)

The owner of the restaurant and his wife were very rude and not accommodating.  The wife handed us the bill immediately after we finished our meal and didn't inquire whether we desired anything else. The waiter was puzzled as to the behavior of the owner's wife.

Our dinner last night was perfection!!!  Welcoming us the moment we set foot in the restaurant. Our waiter and his crew were totally in charge and anticipated all our needs. The food, well what can I say....  Super delicious and great presentation. What impressed me was before they brought our bill, we were asked if we were military or AARP members for senior discounts.   We didn't even ask. We were brought complimentary espresso and dessert!!!  THE BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND FOOD. THANK YOU

We were visiting friends in Las v\Vegas and they took us to their favorite restaurant - a place for special occasions. They were right!  I was told the homemade meatballs, made with filet mignon and veal,  were the best - and they were! A special was the Branzino over a vegetable Rosotta - delicious! I just wish they had provided a larger portion!  You don't have to overspend on as Vegas or limit yourself to the strip - find this place just out of town within 15 minutes - worth the effort!
This was our first time trying this place and it was great. Very attentive, anticipating our needs and we will be back.  Our server was Steve was great, ask for him.

4-17-2017  I went to Gaetano's on a Monday around 5:15pm. I was greeted immediately by a man impeccably dressed and very friendly and seated in an area that I requested.  There was a couple seated near me at the bar watching and discussing the hockey game on TV and I was impressed with the knowledge of the bartender and the patrons about hockey and enjoyed listening to their discussion.  I was immediately tended to with a menu and  my drink order was given.  The servers tended to my every need and seemed to appear as if they were reading my mind.  I was very impressed with the timing of the servers.  I had a Groupon that I paid $20 for $40 worth of food, which I thought was a great bargain.  I ordered the fried Zucchini as a appetizer and Lasagna with an order of Garlic Bread (as I found out that they did not serve Garlic Bread with Lasagna) but did serve a complimentary basket of toasted bread but it's not what I was hungry for.  I was brought a plate that had 5 small deep fried pieces that was not the Zucchini "chips" I was expecting but they were more like fried mozzarella and not wanting to question their version of fried zucchini, and wanting to sample what they brought, I ate the "zucchini".  It was nothing like what I was used to and I I was not impressed.  My Lasagna arrived just as I polished  off the appetizer.  It looked delicious.  It turned out to have one small layer of meat topped with pasta and cheese and it tasted more of pasta, with very little flavor until I  requested some red pepper flakes to give the dish  some dash.  I must admit that I have not eaten very much Italian food other that what is made at home in the Midwest, but I was not impressed with the food.  Like I said the servers were great, the atmosphere was nice and the restaurant was very clean and pleasant.  I just can't say with all honesty, that I found the food to be that good.  They seemed to have some very nice wine which the other customers seemed to enjoy.  My tab came to $44.00 ( $4 over the Groupon Coupon)  I tipped accordingly.  To be fair,  I hope you give them a try and that you have a pleasant experience.

This place was great, if it was in any other town then Vegas it would get five stars. The food is authentic and most of our food seemed and tasted freshly cook. The menu is elegant and authentic but there is not a lot of things that would stand out or have an unusually special taste. When ordering our food I asked for a wine that was not too tannic or fruit forward and alexande our waiter recommended a Sicilian red wine that was exactly what I wanted. A lot of people complained about portion size however me and my girlfriend got a split plate and with the appetizer and bread that was more then enough. It is definitely not a buffet and elegant dining facilities usually focus on the quality of the meal rather then quantity. The crowd was also a bit older then most Vegas restaurants but it is off the strip and we went on a Friday night. I would definitely go to this restaurant again if I was off the strip and wanted authentic Italian food and great wine with knowledgeable staff.

Went back again on a week day. There were about 3 other parties besides mine there, so service was amazing! I tried their special for the day: seafood linguini. Holy MOLY!! It was SOOOO DELICIOUS! There were lobster, crab, clams, muscles, shrimp, calamari, scallops, oh my is right! The flavor was perfect: not too fishy despite having the whole Atlantic in my meal, the sauce wasn't too rich so I could keep eating without getting tired of it, and the meal itself was ginormous. I ate for about 30 minutes straight and didn't make a dent in it. My leftovers fed my boyfriend and I for 2 days!! MmmMMmm =P Plus, I was able to watch the basketball game that was playing in the bar section. What a perfect dinner!  LOVE IT!

My first experience here was amazing. The food was wonderful. I obviously couldn't wait to come back. I have never had a worst experience at a restaurant in my life. We had a 745 reservation didn't receive our food till 9. We ordered the ravioli and there was almost no filling(they were almost flat). They were only kinda warm. We asked the waiter if we could get different ones. Which he said of course no problem. Then all of a sudden the owner comes to table yells at us that is how they make the ravioli and no one has ever complained about them. We then decided to leave.
